snippet: Senator Patrick J. Leahy and Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr. came close to implicitly conceding the existence of a memorandum that approved the killing of Anwar al-Awlaki.
abstract: Sen Patrick J Leahy and Attorney General Eric H Holder Jr, in a budget hearing exchange, come close to conceding the existence of a Justice Department memorandum that approved the targeted killing of a United States citizen, Anwar al-Awlaki, who died in a drone strike in Yemen; Obama administration has refused to confirm or deny the existence of the memo for several months.
lead_paragraph: Senator Patrick J. Leahy and Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr. came close to implicitly conceding the existence of a memorandum that approved the killing of Anwar al-Awlaki.

headline.main: A Not-Quite Confirmation of a Memo Approving Killing
headline.print_headline: A Not-Quite Confirmation Of a Memo Approving Killing
